intro: Sandoricum maingayi, commonly known as the mangrove apple or sea apple, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in brackish water environments, such as mangrove forests, where it plays a vital role in coastal ecosystems. Its fruits, which are edible, are an important food source for various wildlife species.
